New Records: Pete Alonso became the first player in MLB history to hit a go-ahead home run with his team trailing in the ninth inning or later in a winner-take-all playoff game.
Key Match Events: Alonso hit a three-run home run in the top of the ninth inning to give the Mets a 4-2 victory over the Brewers
The Mets trailed 2-0 after Milwaukee's Jake Bauers and Sal Frelick belted back-to-back homers in the bottom of the seventh
Brandon Nimmo singled to put runners at first and third and bring Alonso to the plate in the ninth inning
Post-Match Reflections: Alonso expressed happiness in contributing to the team's victory
The Mets have shown grit and hard work to reach this point
Miscellaneous Highlights: Devin Williams pitched the ninth, giving up an opening single to Sal Frelick and striking out one before Brice Turang hit into a game-ending double play
